content: Average user experience. The latency is driving me up a wall. Maybe 20ms delay on every USB 2.0 computer I've tried and nothing helps. DisplayLink can show 1080P 60Hz with a barely noticeable delay over USB 2.0 and my tablet most certainly has more horsepower in the graphics department than one of those.
Best screen sharing app I've found for doing general work.
Great for use with laptop on site

Used the free version to check if it works, then bought the full version(Windows 10,Android 6) Works great, sometimes it doesn't connect on it's own, but all you have to do is plug in the cable again and restart the app. I had no issues at all once it was connected. Some people complained that sometimes the app mirrors the display, but that is not the app's fault, it's windows. It requires braincells some of you apparently lack, but you have to go to display settings and set it to "extend".
Not what I was expecting for $10, needs zoom or more resolution settings
Works great, using this since my monitor broke, it's a bit wonky just don't connect if you have a full screen app running or else it will crash the service
This app does work on my mac but any text displayed on the tablet is blurry. It is really not up to the standard of a paid app and can be basically summed up by the phrase "It's better than nothing".

No issues with the app. I am using windows btw. If you have all, the software installed and all the drivers installed for your device you will have no issues. You might find that you need to enable USB debugging on the device to allow it to connect as some devices have very strict security settings. Once it is all setup it is just plug it in and it connects. It would be nice to change the behaviour of the touch when using the touch display on the device though.

I had a problem  not able to extend display in windows 10, only work when as duplicate or only display on tablet.  I have a laptop with PC running windows 10 and a samsung galaxy tab s2.  I eventually solved it the problem, and though I would share.  1. Update the phone/tablet USB driver and your graphic drivers on PC. 2. When connected, it still only mirrors. However, if you choose to show only display 2. The tablet will display correctly.  3. Now with display 2 on tablet, extend the desktop. It should work. 4. Take main display back to display 1.

There is one drawback:  I needed something quick, for a five minute project of needing to verify data across three different files, while mobile.  Easiest way to do this was two on one screen and the third on another.  All I had with me was my laptop and my tablet.  This program fit the bill and was free for 10 minutes. The Windows client needs some developer optimization! Otherwise these apps do exactly what they're supposed to (remember it's not ONLY a droid app). Works fine on Win10 Pro & an old Samsung Galaxy Tab3 (KitKat 4.4.2), so newer Android devices/OS versions should be supported.  Despite the provided instructions, you may need to UPDATE DRIVERS FOR MULTIPLE ITEMS in Device Manager. Mine wouldn't work at all until I updated the "SAMSUNG Android ADB Interface" driver which was not mentioned in the instructions. The correct driver pulls from Windows Update, but you have to manually force-check updates to get it.   The Android app doesn't need any settings adjustments but in the Windows client, make sure to set the Framerate to LOW & the Quality to NORMAL. The "Set Resolution" button opens the Windows resolution options, make sure to accept the "Recommended" Windows resolution for the Android device. Anything else made the Android screen so laggy it was unusable, & my PC is a pretty high-end gaming rig with more than enough power to run anything I throw at it.  You need to put in some effort on the Windows side to make it work right, but once you get it set up it's a handy thing to have.

This product worked on my laptop running Windows 10 and my Samsung Tab A once, and then hasn't worked since. After jumping through all of the hoops of making my tablet run in developer mode, now the tablet only mirrors the computer screen instead of extending it. This should be an easy fix, except that it is impossible to get customer support through this company. I have emailed the address on Play's site and also through Splashtop's site and gotten nothing. Many of the "help" links, included the listed above in the description, are broken and don't take you anywhere. It appears that Splashtop used ZenDesk to handle their customer support but then ended their contract. However, they apparently don't have any other service to take it's place. So basically you're own; there won't be any help.  I'm incredibly disappointed in Splashtop for these glaring oversights in customer support. I would not recommend this product to anyone until there is better troubleshooting help from the company.

Tablet's app can't detect the PC app. Paid and waste money

Not sure if the limitations are in the app or the hardware itself. The positive is that it works. Use USB to use a tablet as a secondary monitor. You can change to the tablet's native resolution, it auto rotates so you can use portrait mode too, and generally it works pretty well. However, the latency and CPU usage means it's nowhere near as smooth and seamless as simply using a second monitor. Even with the frame rate set to high it is nowhere near 60Hz and there is noticeable input lag: fine if it were wireless but surprising for a wired connection. Also, when you're done and want to close the app, it does its very best to stay open, even if you close the app from the multitask drawer - you need to open up the app settings and force close it manually. This app is fine if you're desperate and the secondary monitor is mostly just for viewing, but if you're dreaming of ultimate portability and productivity, this still has a ways to go. It works, it just isn't a great experience.
Works well, but does have a lag/sluggish.  Otherwise I'd give it a 5.  Nice to have a dual screen on the road.  Using Acer Aspire S7, Windows 10 and Samsung Note 8.0 running android 4.2.2
Lagging

I dont know why people are giving this a bad review?? I plugged it in and it worked! I am a web developer and now use my tablet as an extended second screen for which this app has been awesome. It is the best wired app out of the lot of them!

Works as advertised.  Just wish the mouse precision would be better.  As it stands the mouse would be all over the place and cannot get a precision lock. Any suggestions as to how to improve that. This app has great potential; however, it has too many bugs to be charging 7 dollars for. The resolution often defaults to some ridiculously low resolution with no option to increase it unless you unplug the device several times and hope that one of the times it unlocks a higher resolution in the windows menu.  Also I must start the app in landscape mode if not the orientation will always be roatated 90 degrees in the wrong direction , again the display properties tab can't fix this.

Works great. Had an issue where it only would mirror my second monitor and wouldn't work as a third independent monitor but after sending an email it was sorted and had great response from the developer. Highly recommended.

It worked the 1st day as a second monitor but the second day it only worked as a mirror which was frustrating. But since I paid for it I had to make it work. I contacted their support team and they helped me resolve it. Thanks a lot

This app is great.  I always want to get a second screen for more productivity on the go with my windows 7 laptop,  like at a coffee shop, so as simple as connecting to my android phone to get an extended screen is very convenient. (no need for bulky hdmi or vga cable!)  There is some slight lag, but for static display, such as for a word document, it doesn't really affect me.  Nice thing is if your laptop is not touchscreen, you can now use the tablet/smartphone as 2nd monitor and use that functionality!   It would be interesting to see if the developer may improve it so you can use 2 external devices for further display (vs just one)   Overall, a very effective app I will continue to use!

I tried the wireless version and like the 5 minute trial, then the wired version and assuming wired is better than witeless i decided i would buy this one. When i first installed the wirless version and the trial ran out the app crashed on my computer after my internet completely went out and i had to restart my router. I assumed nothing but i once i tried the wired one soon the app started crashing on my pc again and then would connect at all and my internet goes out again and it wont let me refund
Like most of these apps its not compatible with my Nvidia GeForce 970MX.  Culprit is OBase.

Seule application du gente à fonctionner chez moi, donc déjà un gros plus ! Works with some work-arounds. If you have an adb process running in the background (e.g. running android studio or an android emulator), then try killing that process first.  There is a noticeable and annoying input lag, such that the tablet isn't suitable for some tasks. It's still useful for having some info up on the screen, but e.g. maybe not for typing something on it.

This is a great tool to have. It's not as responsive as an actual monitor, but it's good enough for working with text like Word or Excel. I'm a network engineer that works a lot from home during change windows. I use this app on my little Galaxy Tab E connected to my HP laptop to run my SSH terminal. Works great!
Works great with windows 10 laptop + Nexus 10 tablet as extended monitor.
Very cool and exactly what I  was looking for. Easy to set up. After downloading both programs I had it running an extended screen in under 2 minutes. Using windows 10/galaxy tab pro 12.2.

It *works*. Win10 laptop (Asus T100) with Nexus 7 (2013) and my Huawei Honor 5x. There aren't that many options, but you *do* have multiple resolutions available, and if you set it to normal clarity with high refresh, you can actually watch Netflix on the tablet screen with the audio *almost* in sync 100% of the time. I suspect a faster PC would work even better. @1920x1200 resolution, it's usable as a reader. @ default resolution, my Netflix test, 960x600 or similar. NO OTHER APP I TESTED AND BOUGHT WORKED. Spent over $50 on apps, none worked. This one did.

I have always wanted an app with this functionality and WiredXDisplay works really well. Occasionally I have to unplug and reconnect the usb cable to get it to start. But  that is only a minor annoyance.
Works a treat
I had slight problems starting out because of all the stupid phone companion crap, but after that it works like it should

My review of twomonusb tells how installing the Splashtop Wired XDisplay solved a day of frustration trying to get twomonusb to work. I now have both apps working, but I credit Splashtop for carrying me all the way through to getting the USB connection that I wanted. The key seems to be that Splashtop triggers having my off brand tablet ask me to trust the computer (Windows 10) that I"m connecting to.  The program worked more or less the first time around on two different Windows 10 machines. Once it's working, it's truly amazing. My older Windows 10 laptop now has touch screen capabilities and a bigger portable screen! There's little or no noticeable delay in the tablet duplicating the laptop screen. Mouse works, etc.  If this is what you're looking for, I strongly recommend. Will be great for my travels.
How I  do create a multiple monitor setup instead of mirroring my main.  Windows + P brings up the menu but does nothing when I select extend.

Despite Splashtop's history of abandoning software after a year or two, I purchased this anyway. I've been happy with it so far and use it frequently (usually only to have a terminal open to monitor) and have seen a few updates to address bugs and performance . I've had no major problems with it in OS X 10.11 or on Win 10. There are a few cons, though. There's no Linux support (I do a lot of Web dev work in Ubuntu), there's very noticeable lag but I've unfortunately seen this in every app like this I've used, and the aspect ratio when using this on OS X is 1:1 so it doesn't use the full real estate of the screen. Overall I'm happy with this but OS X aspect ratio and Linux support will hopefully be addressed soon.
Laptop + 10" tablet + mountie + retractable micro USB cable. Pure awesome

Except this, everything's great.

Could be a bit more responsive, but it is one of the best android/ios apps that turn your tab/phone into a second/third/fourth screen. :) Hopefully they can optimize it even more so I can rate this 5 stars.
